title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire for Tuesday, 1 December 2015 - BBC News
summary: lumbertubs primary school in northampton is appealing for new christmas decorations after they were ruined by mice .
play about motown legend marvin gaye to have world premiere in northampton .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage through the day
text: local live is finished for today , but we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with all the news , weather , sport and travel for northamptonshire .

documents.title: mp for south northamptonshire will vote for air strike in syria
text: south northamptonshire mp andrea leadsom says she 's planning to support extending air strikes against the so-called islamic state to syria .
mps will spend all of tomorrow debating the prime minister 's plans .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : cloudy this evening , dry tomorrow
text: largely cloudy skies tonight with temperature down to 9c ( 48f ) .
it will be a dry day for most of tomorrow with a top temperature of 12c ( 54f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: northampton south mp will vote for air strikes to 'destroy is '
text: david mackintosh , the mp for northampton south , says he will `` support the prime minister 's position '' on air strikes on is targets in syria following a briefing with the defence , foreign , international development and home secretaries .
mr mackintosh said : `` the raf is already carrying out air strikes against is in iraq , but we need to go further to protect our own national security and destroy is . ''
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton school for boys is top school for sport in england
text: northampton school for boys has been named the best state school in england for sport in a list published by school sport magazine .

teams from northampton school for boys have , in the past 12 months , reached national finals in cross country , athletics , basketball and team golf , while the under-15 football team reached the national semi-final and the under-12 's reached a national quarter final .
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: mp for kettering will vote against air strikes in syria
text: philip hollobone has told me .
he 's voting against air strikes in syria , having seen the motion that will go before parliament tomorrow .
he said there is no clear plan for who will occupy ground vacated by so-called islamic state following any air strikes in syria .
he added that such action could create a new vacuum , which may be filled by al-qaeda and other extremists .
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: centres for children in deprived areas of corby and northampton keep funding
text: there 's been big relief from the management at the pen green and camrose children 's centre after a decision was made to keep funding levels the same .
the centres help children in some of the most deprived areas of corby and northampton respectively .
the school 's forum rejected the option of cutting funding and spreading it across all of the county 's centres .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: kyren wilson loses in third round of uk championships
text: kettering snooker player kyren wilson has lost his third round match against tom ford 6-1 in the uk championship at the york barbican .
speaking after the loss , the shanghai masters winner said that losing this early in the big events was `` no longer acceptable '' .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: northampton north mp planning to vote for air strikes in syria
text: northampton north mp , michael ellis , says he will listen to the debate over air strikes against the so-called islamic state in syria , but is currently planning to support the prime minister .
the conservative mp says strikes would be in the `` national interest '' .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: more than a third of secondary school pupils do n't go to good or outstanding schools
text: ofsted have published their annual report into schools , including those in northamptonshire .
nationally , the schools inspector is warning about anorth-south dividein secondary schools .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: corby mp pursglove 'listening to the arguments ' over syrian air strikes
text: corby 's conservative mp says he 's minded to vote for air strikes against the so-called islamic state in syria .
tom pursglove says he has been listening to the arguments and his constituents .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: conman who masqueraded as a woman jailed for seven years
text: a conman from northampton , who targeted and defrauded women , some of whom he met online , has been sentenced to seven years in prison and given a 10 year restraining order .
matthew sprigmore , 40 , of woolston close , northampton , pleaded guilty to numerous offences relating to fraud , blackmail , theft and assault .
det con cathy o'connor , who led the investigation , said : he even masqueraded as a woman , changing the tone and pitch of his voice , when speaking to banks . ''
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northamptonshire 's cricketers begin 2016 season on april 10
text: northamptonshire will begin their 2016 county championship division two season at home to sussex on sunday 10 april .
their t20 campaign starts with a trip to leicestershire on friday 20 may , and the 50 over competition starts on monday , 6 june at nottinghamshire .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: constituents have swayed daventry mp to support air strikes in syria
text: chris heaton-harris , the mp for daventry , says he has decided to `` support the prime minister '' and vote for air strikes against the so-called islamic state in syria .

he said he has been `` contacted by a number of constituents '' and has `` been thinking about the concerns raised , '' as well as speaking to experts and members of the armed forces before coming to a decision .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: number of primary school pupils going to good or outstanding schools below national average
text: the annual report from school inspector ofsted has found northamptonshire is lagging behind the national average for the number of pupils going to good or outstanding schools in the county
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thieves steal gift cards and punch morrisons staff in the face 'several ' times
text: two thieves walked into morrisons in northampton and grabbed handfuls of amazon gift cards .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: mp for kettering has n't made his mind up on syrian airstrikes
text: philip hollobone , the mp for kettering , says he 'll decide how to vote on air strike on so-called islamic state in syria when he sees the wording of the commons motion .
the conservative mp says he 's currently minded to vote against , as he did in 2013 when the suggested target was syrian president bashar al-assad 's government .
he said he has not made a final decision .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: women dies in crash near slipton
text: a woman died in a crash between two cars on the road between slipton and kettering yesterday morning .
the 40-year-old woman was driving a ford focus when the collision took place at about 11.50 .
the driver of the second car , a 41-year-old woman who was also driving a ford focus in the opposite direction , was taken to university hospital coventry with serious injuries .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: two northamptonshire children 's centres could see funding cut
text: i 'm off to a meeting of the northamptonshire 's schools forum to hear about the future of funding for two of the county 's children 's centres .
pen green in corby ( camrose in northampton could see their grants cut , with the money instead spread across all the county 's centres .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: dog walkers without poo bags in daventry could get £ 1,000 fine
text: dog walkers without poo bags in daventry could get £ 1,000 fine

documents.title: headlines : fatal road crash in slipton hiv testing encouraged
text: if you 're catching up , here are the stories we are looking at :
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: public exhibition on possible bypass for farthinghoe
text: plans to build a possible bypass for the a422 at farthinghoe will go on displayat the end of this week .
author: Brackley & Towcester Advertiser

documents.title: mp says he may support air strikes , but could get it 'terribly wrong '
text: northamptonshire 's mps say they are listening to the arguments as they decide how to vote on uk air strikes against the so-called islamic state in syria .
the conservative mp for wellingborough peter bone says he 's minded to vote to support air strikes , but admitted he may be getting it `` terribly wrong '' .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: headlines : hiv checks encouraged kettering 's wilson in uk championships
text: here are the latest headlines for northamptonshire
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: desborough linesman who reached 1,000-game milestone forced to retire after suffering stroke
text: a desborough football official who was recently a linesman for the 1,000th time has flagged offside for the last time after suffering a minor stroke .
author: Northamptonshire Telegraph

documents.title: nearly 900 cases of hiv in northamptonshire
text: today is world aids day and northamptonshire healthcare foundation trust has revealed how many people they are dealing with in the county who have hiv .
there are five new cases every month .

documents.title: wilson plays in third round of uk championships later today
text: kettering 's kyren wilson will take on tom ford in the third round of the uk snooker championships in york later today .
wilson , who is aiming for a second ranking title after winning at shanghai in september , beat mike dunn 6-2 in the second round at the weekend .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: car park at daventry country park to close for improvement works
text: the car park at daventry country park is to close for three days for improvement works .
author: Daventry Express

documents.title: school 's appeal for decorations after mice try to ruin christmas
text: lumbertubs primary school in northampton are asking for help after their christmas decorations were eaten by mice .

documents.title: man dies in crash with lorry on a43
text: a man has died following a collision on the a43 near broughton junction at 16:30 yesterday .
a ford fiesta and a mercedes lorry were travelling in opposite directions , when the ford moved into the opposite carriageway and collided with the lorry .
the cause is not yet known .
the 19-year-old man from northampton , who was the driver of the fiesta , sustained fatal injuries and died at the scene .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: play about motown legend marvin gaye to have world premiere in northampton
text: roy williams ' soul , about motown legend marvin gaye , will open in may 2016 at the royal theatre , after several years ' close collaboration with members of the singer 's family .
`` it 's a dramatic thriller , not a musical , it will have the spirit and energy of motown and will include music from the time . ''
said james dacre , the royal & derngate theatre 's artistic director .
author: Tim Masters
Arts and Entertainment correspondent

documents.title: northampton busker dan set to perform in front of top music labels in final of national talent search
text: a high street busker from northampton is another step closer to achieving his dream of stardom after landing himself a spot in the grand final of a national talent competition .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: world aids day marked in northamptonshire
text: northamptonshire healthcare foundation trust has marked world aids day today by encouraging people to have a simple hiv test to check their status .
they have also revealed the number of cases they have to deal with

documents.title: weather : drizzly spells , turning brighter later
text: it will be a mostly cloudy day with a few patches of drizzle .
top temperature : 13c ( 55f ) .
you can see my full forecast below
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: headlines : five new case of hiv a month school needs decoration donations
text: here are our top stories this tuesday morning :
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: a14 disruption at kettering
text: a car and a lorry have crashed on the a14 near junction nine for kettering , causing delays in both directions .
this adds to existing delays westbound at junction seven because of overrunning roadworks .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning and welcome to local live for northamptonshire
text: it 's december !
between now and 18:00 we 'll bring you the latest news , weather , sport and travel for northamptonshire .
if you have something you want to share then you can email me , tweet us or head to facebook .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live
